head.title: World Briefing | Europe: France: Now There Are Three

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: France: Now There Are Three

abstract.p: France has more babies in 2006 than in any year in last quarter-century, capping decade of rising fertility that bucks Europe's graying trend; government cites family-friendly policies like cheap day care and generous parental leave (S)

block.p: René Riffaud, one of just four known surviving French veterans of World War I, died at the age of 108, according to the national veterans office. His existence was unknown to the authorities until last year, when he emerged from obscurity to claim veteran status under pressure from relatives. Nationwide commemorations are expected at the death of the last member of the group.
